com.analog.lyric.dimple.factorfunctions.core

Interface IFactorTableBase

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<FactorTableEntry>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IFactorTable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FactorTable, FactorTableBase, SparseFactorTable, SparseFactorTableBase

    public interface IFactorTableBase
extends java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<FactorTableEntry>

    • Method Summary

      If isDirected() returns object indicating the indices of the subset of dimensions/domains that represent inputs or the "from" size of the directionality.

      If isDirected() returns object indicating the indices of the subset of dimensions/domains that represent outputs or the "to" size of the directionality.

      boolean hasDenseEnergies()
      True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of energies indexed by joint index.
      boolean hasDenseRepresentation()
      True if either hasDenseEnergies() or hasDenseWeights() is true.
      boolean hasDenseWeights()
      True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of weights indexed by joint index.
      boolean hasMaximumDensity()
      True if table has density() is 1.0 and there are no zero weights.
      boolean hasSparseEnergies()
      True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of energies indexed by a sparse index and a second array that maps sparse indices to joint indices.
      boolean hasSparseRepresentation()
      True if underlying representation contains a sparse representation of non-zero weights.
      boolean hasSparseWeights()
      True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of weights indexed by a sparse index and a second array that maps sparse indices to joint indices.
      boolean isConditional()
      True if table is in form appropriate for conditional distribution, i.e.
      boolean isDeterministicDirected()
      True if table isDirected() and has exactly one entry for each combination of input indices with a non-zero weight.
      boolean isDirected()
      True if table has designated input/output domains directed, in which case getInputSet() will be non-null.
      boolean isNormalized()
      True if the table is not directed and its weights add up to 1.0
      IFactorTableIterator iterator()
      Returns an iterator over the non-zero entries in the table in increasing order of sparse/joint index.
      int jointSize()
      The number of possible combinations of the values of all the domains in this table.
      void normalize()
      Normalizes the weights/energies of the table by dividing by a constant to ensure that weights add up to one.
      void normalizeConditional()
      Normalizes the weights/energies of directed table to ensure that weights applicable to any combination of input elements add up to one.

      Sets the table value indexed by the specified elements to the given energy value.

      Computes domain indices corresponding to given sparse index.

      Converts sparse index (one per table entry) to joint index (one per valid combination of domain indices).
      int sparseSize()
      The number of entries in the table that can be accessed by a sparse index.
      boolean supportsJointIndexing()
      True if table supports operations involving jointIndex values or dense representation.

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        IFactorTableIterator iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the non-zero entries in the table in increasing order of sparse/joint index.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<FactorTableEntry>
        See Also:
        fullIterator()

      • fullIterator

        IFactorTableIterator fullIterator()
        Returns an iterator over the joint indexes in the table in increasing order.
        See Also:
        iterator()

      • clone

        IFactorTableBase clone()
        Returns a deep copy of this factor table.

      • countNonZeroWeights

        int countNonZeroWeights()
        Computes the number of entries in the table with non-zero weight (or non-infinite energy).

      • convert

        IFactorTableBase convert(JointDomainReindexer converter)
        Returns a new factor table converted from this one using the specified converter.

      • density

        double density()
        That ratio of non-zero weights to jointSize(). Will be 1.0 if table contains no entries with zero weight.

      • evalDeterministic

        void evalDeterministic(Value[] arguments)
        Deterministically compute output arguments from input arguments.

        If table isDeterministicDirected(), this method looks at the input arguments designated by the set bits of getInputSet() and sets the remaining output arguments from them.

        Throws:
        DimpleException - not isDeterministicDirected().

      • getDimensions

        int getDimensions()
        The number of dimensions in the table.

        The same as getDomainIndexer().size().

      • getEnergyForIndicesDense

        double getEnergyForIndicesDense(int... indices)
        Returns energy for given set of indices assuming that the table has a dense representation for energies. This provides the fastest possible lookup for energies.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - may throw if indices are out of bound or table does not have dense energies.
        See Also:
        hasDenseEnergies(), getEnergyForIndices(int...), getWeightForIndicesDense(int...)

      • getEnergyForValuesDense

        double getEnergyForValuesDense(Value... values)

      • getWeightForIndicesDense

        double getWeightForIndicesDense(int... indices)
        Returns weight for given set of indices assuming that the table has a dense representation for weights. This provides the fastest possible lookup for weights.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - may throw if indices are out of bound or table does not have dense weights.
        See Also:
        hasDenseWeights(), getWeightForIndices(int...), getEnergyForIndicesDense(int...)

      • getWeightForValuesDense

        double getWeightForValuesDense(Value... values)

      • getDomainIndexer

        JointDomainIndexer getDomainIndexer()
        The domain indexer for the table represents the domains of the table dimensions and denotes the directionality of the table dimensions if table is directed.

        It is used to map between different representations identifying a table entry: i.e. array of elements of each respective domain, array of discrete domain indices of each respective domain, or a single integer representing the location of the entry in the dense representation of the table.

      • getEnergyForElements

        double getEnergyForElements(java.lang.Object... elements)
        Returns energy of factor table entry for given elements.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForIndices(int...), getWeightForElements(Object...)

      • getEnergyForJointIndex

        double getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex)
        Returns energy of factor table entry for given jointIndex.

        See Also:
        getWeightForJointIndex(int)

      • getEnergyForSparseIndex

        double getEnergyForSparseIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Returns energy of factor table entry at given sparseIndex.

        The energy is the same as the negative log of the weight for the same sparseIndex.

        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - should be value less than sparseSize() specifying which table entry to access.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if sparseIndex is not in range [0,sparseSize()).
        See Also:
        getEnergyForIndices(int...), getWeightForSparseIndex(int)

      • getEnergyForIndices

        double getEnergyForIndices(int... indices)
        Returns the energy of factor table entry with given indices.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForElements(Object...), getEnergyForSparseIndex(int), getWeightForIndices(int...)

      • getEnergyForValues

        double getEnergyForValues(Value... values)

      • getInputSet

        @Nullable
java.util.BitSet getInputSet()
        If isDirected() returns object indicating the indices of the subset of dimensions/domains that represent inputs or the "from" size of the directionality. Returns null if table is not directed. The output set is simply the inverse of the input set (i.e. represented by the clear bits instead of the set bits).
        See Also:
        getOutputSet()

      • getOutputSet

        @Nullable
java.util.BitSet getOutputSet()
        If isDirected() returns object indicating the indices of the subset of dimensions/domains that represent outputs or the "to" size of the directionality. Returns null if table is not directed. The input set is simply the inverse of the output set (i.e. represented by the clear bits instead of the set bits).
        See Also:
        getInputSet()

      • getWeightForElements

        double getWeightForElements(java.lang.Object... elements)
        Returns weight of factor table entry for given elements.

        See Also:
        getWeightForIndices(int...), getEnergyForElements(Object...)

      • getWeightForJointIndex

        double getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex)
        Returns weight of factor table entry for given jointIndex.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForJointIndex(int)

      • getWeightForSparseIndex

        double getWeightForSparseIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Returns weight of factor table entry at given sparseIndex.

        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - should be value less than sparseSize() specifying which table entry to access.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if sparseIndex is not in range [0, sparseSize()).
        See Also:
        getWeightForIndices(int...), getEnergyForSparseIndex(int)

      • getWeightForIndices

        double getWeightForIndices(int... indices)
        Returns the weight of factor table entry with given indices.

        See Also:
        getWeightForElements(Object[]), getWeightForSparseIndex(int), getEnergyForIndices(int[])

      • getWeightForValues

        double getWeightForValues(Value... values)

      • hasDenseRepresentation

        boolean hasDenseRepresentation()
        True if either hasDenseEnergies() or hasDenseWeights() is true.

      • hasDenseEnergies

        boolean hasDenseEnergies()
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of energies indexed by joint index.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set energy by joint index or combined element indices.

        See Also:
        hasDenseWeights(), hasSparseEnergies()

      • hasDenseWeights

        boolean hasDenseWeights()
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of weights indexed by joint index.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set weight by joint index or combined element indices.

        See Also:
        hasDenseEnergies(), hasSparseWeights()

      • hasMaximumDensity

        boolean hasMaximumDensity()
        True if table has density() is 1.0 and there are no zero weights.
        Since:
        0.05

      • hasSparseRepresentation

        boolean hasSparseRepresentation()
        True if underlying representation contains a sparse representation of non-zero weights.

        True if hasSparseEnergies(), hasSparseWeights() or isDeterministicDirected().

      • hasSparseEnergies

        boolean hasSparseEnergies()
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of energies indexed by a sparse index and a second array that maps sparse indices to joint indices.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set energy by sparse index.

        See Also:
        hasSparseWeights(), hasDenseEnergies()

      • hasSparseWeights

        boolean hasSparseWeights()
        True if underlying representation of table values includes an array of weights indexed by a sparse index and a second array that maps sparse indices to joint indices.

        This is the optimal representation for methods that get/set weight by sparse index.

        See Also:
        hasSparseEnergies(), hasDenseWeights()

      • isDeterministicDirected

        boolean isDeterministicDirected()
        True if table isDirected() and has exactly one entry for each combination of input indices with a non-zero weight.
        See Also:
        evalDeterministic(Value[])

      • isConditional

        boolean isConditional()
        True if table is in form appropriate for conditional distribution, i.e. if it is directed and the sum of the weights of entries for any given combination of input elements is a constant.

        See Also:
        isDirected(), normalizeConditional()

      • isDirected

        boolean isDirected()
        True if table has designated input/output domains directed, in which case getInputSet() will be non-null.

        For most applications the table should have weights normalized so that isConditional() also is true.

      • isNormalized

        boolean isNormalized()
        True if the table is not directed and its weights add up to 1.0

        See Also:
        isDirected()

      • jointSize

        int jointSize()
        The number of possible combinations of the values of all the domains in this table. Same as JointDomainIndexer.getCardinality() of getDomainIndexer().
        See Also:
        sparseSize()

      • sparseIndexFromElements

        int sparseIndexFromElements(java.lang.Object... elements)
        Computes sparse index for the table entry associated with the specified arguments.

        Parameters:
        elements - must have length equal to getDimensions() and each argument must be an element of the corresponding domain.
        See Also:
        sparseIndexFromIndices(int[]), sparseIndexFromElements(Object[])

      • sparseIndexFromIndices

        int sparseIndexFromIndices(int... indices)
        Computes a sparse index for the table entry associated with the specified indices.
        Parameters:
        indices - must have length equal to getDimensions() and each index must be a non-negative value less than the corresponding domain size otherwise the function could return an incorrect result.
        Returns:
        sparse index for table entry with given set of indices. Returns negative value if there is no such entry.
        See Also:
        sparseIndexFromElements(java.lang.Object...), sparseIndexToIndices(int, int[])

      • sparseIndexFromValues

        int sparseIndexFromValues(Value... values)

      • sparseIndexFromJointIndex

        int sparseIndexFromJointIndex(int joint)
        Converts joint index (oner per valid combination of domain indices) to sparse index.

        Returns:
        if joint has a corresponding table entry its location is returned as a number in the range [0,sparseSize()), otherwise it returns -1-location where location is the location where the entry would be if it were in the table.
        See Also:
        sparseIndexToJointIndex(int)

      • sparseIndexToElements

        java.lang.Object[] sparseIndexToElements(int sparseIndex,
                                       @Nullable
                                       java.lang.Object[] elements)
        Computes domain values corresponding to given joint index.

        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - index in the range [0,sparseSize()).
        elements - if this is an array of length getDimensions(), the computed values will be placed in this array, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        See Also:
        sparseIndexToIndices(int, int[]), sparseIndexFromElements(Object...)

      • sparseIndexToJointIndex

        int sparseIndexToJointIndex(int sparseIndex)
        Converts sparse index (one per table entry) to joint index (one per valid combination of domain indices).

        The sparse and joint index values should have the same ordering relationship, so that 

           sparse1 < sparse2
        implies that 
            t.sparseIndexToJointIndex(sparse1) < t.sparseIndexToJointIndex(sparse2)

        Returns:
        joint index in range [0,jointSize()).
        See Also:
        sparseIndexFromJointIndex(int)

      • sparseIndexToIndices

        int[] sparseIndexToIndices(int sparseIndex,
                         @Nullable
                         int[] indices)
        Computes domain indices corresponding to given sparse index.
        Parameters:
        sparseIndex - index in range [0,sparseSize()).
        indices - if this is an array of length getDimensions(), the computed values will be placed in this array, otherwise a new array will be allocated.
        See Also:
        sparseIndexToElements(int, Object[]), sparseIndexFromIndices(int...)

      • sparseIndexToIndices

        int[] sparseIndexToIndices(int sparseIndex)

      • normalize

        void normalize()
        Normalizes the weights/energies of the table by dividing by a constant to ensure that weights add up to one.

        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isDirected(), use normalizeConditional() instead.

        See Also:
        isNormalized()

      • normalizeConditional

        void normalizeConditional()
        Normalizes the weights/energies of directed table to ensure that weights applicable to any combination of input elements add up to one.

        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if not isDirected(), use normalize() instead.

        See Also:
        isConditional()

      • setEnergyForElements

        void setEnergyForElements(double energy,
                        java.lang.Object... elements)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified elements to the given energy value.

        See Also:

      • setEnergyForIndices

                       int... indices)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified indices to the given energy value.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setEnergyForValues

        void setEnergyForValues(double energy,
                      Value... values)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified values to the given energy value.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setEnergyForSparseIndex

        void setEnergyForSparseIndex(double energy,
                           int sparseIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified sparseIndex to the given energy value.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setEnergyForJointIndex

        void setEnergyForJointIndex(double energy,
                          int jointIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified jointIndex to the given energy value.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForElements

        void setWeightForElements(double weight,
                        java.lang.Object... elements)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified elements to the given weight value.

        See Also:
        getWeightForElements(Object...), setWeightForIndices(double, int...), setWeightForJointIndex(double, int), setEnergyForElements(double, Object...)

      • setWeightForIndices

        void setWeightForIndices(double weight,
                       int... indices)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified indices to the given weight value.

        See Also:
        getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int), setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForValues

        void setWeightForValues(double weight,
                      Value... values)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified values to the given weight value.

        See Also:
        getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int), setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForSparseIndex

        void setWeightForSparseIndex(double weight,
                           int sparseIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified sparseIndex to the given weight value.

        See Also:
        getWeightForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setWeightForSparseIndex(double, int), setEnergyForJointIndex(double, int)

      • setWeightForJointIndex

        void setWeightForJointIndex(double weight,
                          int jointIndex)
        Sets the table value indexed by the specified jointIndex to the given energy value.

        See Also:
        getEnergyForJointIndex(int jointIndex), setEnergyForSparseIndex(double, int), setWeightForJointIndex(double, int)

      • sparseSize

        int sparseSize()
        The number of entries in the table that can be accessed by a sparse index. This can be no larger than jointSize() and if smaller, indicates that the table has a sparse representation that does not include combinations with zero weight/infinite energy. The actual number of non-zero weight entries may be less than the sparse size.

      • supportsJointIndexing

        boolean supportsJointIndexing()
        True if table supports operations involving jointIndex values or dense representation. If false, then methods that return or use such arguments will throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
